page.title: 03Exe Estuary- wild life site
page.content: The Estuary is nationally renowned as a a winter feeding ground for{migratory} birds, many on route from arctic areas to N.Africa.It is notable for its range of species, for during an average year about 180 of the 460 species of bird that live in or visit Britain can be seen here.A new edition of{"Birdwatch"} a BBC TV programme,was based here and described the estuary as a Garden of Eden for Birds.{Oystercatchers}greatly out number other birds.They have long beaks adapted for prising open shell fish exposed at low tide.Lapwing,Grey Plover,Redshank,Godwits all feed on worms on the mud flats.Dunlin are common in large flocks. Reedwarblers find food on the reed banks at the side of the salt marsh.
